p.b: Q: Whatâ€™s the relationship between N1QL and SQL++?

body.p: SQL++ is a formal language specification designed with the goal fo unifying various query languages for handling semi-structured data to produce a single, clean, powerful, declarative query language with well-defined semantics. Couchbase SQL++ is the language used in Couchbase Analytics; N1QL is the query language used by the Couchbase Server query service. N1QL's design was inspired by SQL++ and it is a proper subset of SQL++. Both languages are quite similar, and over time, the differences between the languages will disappear.

p.b: Q: Can I use this with memcached buckets?

body.p: No, CBAS relies on DCP and JSON formatted documents. It can only be used with JSON coming from a Couchbase bucket.

p.b: Q: I got an error message complaining about types: "field-access-by-name: expects input type NULL or RECORD, but got INT64". What does that mean?

body.p: This error occurs when you try to apply a function to a value that that function does not support. You may be encountering this because a return value is not what you expected, possibly because a query contains ambiguous identifiers that get resolved to a different value than you intended. You can try to specify the identifier fully to resolve the ambiguity.
